There are two types of visible emissions; point source and fugitive. Point source emissions come from smokestacks, chimneys, vents and pipes. Any exhaust device which concentrates emissions is a point source.

Fugitive emissions are those that do not pass through a point source. Sources of fugitive emissions include unpaved roads, storage piles, material handling and material transfer.  Fugitive emissions are not concentrated into a single exhaust point such as a stack or vent.
